snippet: Scientists have identified four regions of DNA that play a major role in controlling animal behavior: telling a mouse how long a burrow to dig and whether to add an escape tunnel.
abstract: Report in Nature identifies four regions of DNA that play major role in telling deer mice how long a burrow to dig and whether to add an escape tunnel; finding may aid understanding of human behavior.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have identified four regions of DNA that play a major role in controlling animal behavior: telling a mouse how long a burrow to dig and whether to add an escape tunnel.

headline.seo: Mouse Study Discovers DNA That Controls Behavior
headline.main: Study Discovers DNA That Tells Mice How to Construct Their Homes
headline.print_headline: Study Discovers DNA That Tells Mice How to Construct Their Homes
